Python Intermediate

10-Week Advanced Python Course Outline

Week 1: Review of Python Basics and Course Goals

  • Quick review of key basic concepts: loops, functions, and data types
  • Introduction to course structure and expectations
  • Mini-project: Revise and enhance a previous project (e.g., Guess the Number)

Week 2: File Handling

  • Reading from and writing to files
  • Working with text and CSV files
  • Mini-project: Create a simple diary or note-taking application

Week 3: Error Handling and Debugging

  • Common Python errors and how to fix them
  • Using try, except, finally for error handling
  • Debugging tips and tools
  • Mini-project: Build a program with intentional errors and debug it

Week 4: Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) Basics

  • Introduction to classes and objects
  • Attributes, methods, and the self keyword
  • Mini-project: Create a class-based animal or character simulator

Week 5: Advanced OOP Concepts

  • Inheritance, polymorphism, and encapsulation
  • Magic methods (__init__, __str__, etc.)
  • Mini-project: Build a class hierarchy for a game (e.g., players, enemies)

Week 6: Working with Modules and Libraries

  • What are modules and libraries?
  • Installing and using third-party libraries (pip)
  • Introduction to popular Python libraries: math, random, datetime
  • Mini-project: Build a random password generator or calendar program

Week 7: Introduction to Data Structures and Algorithms

  • Lists, tuples, sets, and dictionaries in depth
  • Sorting and searching algorithms (e.g., bubble sort)
  • Mini-project: Create a leaderboard system for a game

Week 8: Simple Data Visualization

  • Introduction to the matplotlib library
  • Creating basic charts (line, bar, pie)
  • Mini-project: Visualize data from a simple quiz or survey

Week 9: Advanced Game Development Concepts

  • Using the pygame library for graphical games
  • Adding images, sounds, and controls to games
  • Mini-project: Build a basic interactive game (e.g., a maze or pong game)

Week 10: Capstone Project

  • Plan, design, and develop a complete project from start to finish
  • Example projects:
    • A text-based RPG
    • A simple graphical game using pygame
    • A basic personal finance tracker
  • Present projects to the class and celebrate achievements!
